quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Grimgor is da greatest!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Grimgor is da greatest!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The only good stunty is a dead stunty, and the only thing better than a dead stunty is a dyin’ stunty who tells yer where to find ’is mates.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The only good stunty is a dead stunty, and the only thing better than a dead stunty is a dyin’ stunty who tells yer where to find ’is mates.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Everyfing I see is mine. All da uvver bits are mine too – I just ain’t got there yet. When we reach da end of da world, we’ll turn around an’ march back.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Everyfing I see is mine. All da uvver bits are mine too – I just ain’t got there yet. When we reach da end of da world, we’ll turn around an’ march back.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I’m gonna stomp ’em to dust. I’m gonna grind their bones. I’m gonna burn down dere towns and cities. I’m gonna pile ’em up inna big fire and roast ’em. I’m gonna bash ’eads, break faces and jump up and down on da bits dat are left. An’ den I’m gonna get really mean.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I’m gonna stomp ’em to dust. I’m gonna grind their bones. I’m gonna burn down dere towns and cities. I’m gonna pile ’em up inna big fire and roast ’em. I’m gonna bash ’eads, break faces and jump up and down on da bits dat are left. An’ den I’m gonna get really mean.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: For ten thousand kindred dead we swear vengeance against Grimspike Pass. No peace until the mountain is mined to exhaustion and the rocks of the pass are as dust.

quotes.quote_onscreen: For ten thousand kindred dead we swear vengeance against Grimspike Pass. No peace until the mountain is mined to exhaustion and the rocks of the pass are as dust.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Ere we go, ’ere we go, ’ere we go!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Ere we go, ’ere we go, ’ere we go!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Flank ’em, shoot ’em, hit ’em hard, and then do it again from annuver angle. Of course, if da battle is going bad for our side, I’m gonna keep ridin’ and act like I wuz never there, so yer’d better stick close!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Flank ’em, shoot ’em, hit ’em hard, and then do it again from annuver angle. Of course, if da battle is going bad for our side, I’m gonna keep ridin’ and act like I wuz never there, so yer’d better stick close!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: If I find out ’oo ate me favourite snottie then there is gonna be sum trouble. I wuz savin’ ’im, I wuz. Ded clever lil’ feller – he could fetchit right quick. ’Course, it wuz never wot I asked fer, but yer could see he wuz eager. Poor lil’ feller.

quotes.quote_onscreen: If I find out ’oo ate me favourite snottie then there is gonna be sum trouble. I wuz savin’ ’im, I wuz. Ded clever lil’ feller – he could fetchit right quick. ’Course, it wuz never wot I asked fer, but yer could see he wuz eager. Poor lil’ feller.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: He snores and eats all our gobbos, but dat big lug is handy in a fight…

quotes.quote_onscreen: He snores and eats all our gobbos, but dat big lug is handy in a fight…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I dunno Boss, I tried to give da Shaman yer orders, but da bug-eyed loon is just talkin’ to that skull wand of his. Da funny thing is, Boss… I fink I ’eard it talkin’ back.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I dunno Boss, I tried to give da Shaman yer orders, but da bug-eyed loon is just talkin’ to that skull wand of his. Da funny thing is, Boss… I fink I ’eard it talkin’ back.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: That which is wrong with the world that we cannot fix with the blades of our axes, we shall surely avenge.

quotes.quote_onscreen: That which is wrong with the world that we cannot fix with the blades of our axes, we shall surely avenge.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: New ideas lead to trouble.

quotes.quote_onscreen: New ideas lead to trouble.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Hold back your fire and let us pass. We have taken the Slayer's Oath and would pit our axes against those beasts. If we come back, have all your ale ready. If, instead, it is our time to take the Path of Grimnir, then may our doom be a mighty one. If we do not return, remember us to our Clans and Kings.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Hold back your fire and let us pass. We have taken the Slayer's Oath and would pit our axes against those beasts. If we come back, have all your ale ready. If, instead, it is our time to take the Path of Grimnir, then may our doom be a mighty one. If we do not return, remember us to our Clans and Kings.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text:
...Thou shalt give unto thine glorious liege the taxes that he requires.
Thou shalt labour all but feast days,
And no more than a tenth-share shall you keep for kith and kin.
Rejoice! For a Knight of Bretonnia provides your shield...

quotes.quote_onscreen:
...Thou shalt give unto thine glorious liege the taxes that he requires.
Thou shalt labour all but feast days,
And no more than a tenth-share shall you keep for kith and kin.
Rejoice! For a Knight of Bretonnia provides your shield...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text:
...That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve,
That which is sublime I will protect,
That which threatens, I will destroy,
For my holy wrath will know no bounds...

quotes.quote_onscreen:
...That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve,
That which is sublime I will protect,
That which threatens, I will destroy,
For my holy wrath will know no bounds...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: ...I set down my lance, symbol of duty. I spurn those whom I love, I relinquish all, and take up the tools of my quest.\nNo obstacle will stand before me. No plea for help shall find me wanting. No moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle.\nI give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek...

quotes.quote_onscreen: ...I set down my lance, symbol of duty. I spurn those whom I love, I relinquish all, and take up the tools of my quest.\nNo obstacle will stand before me. No plea for help shall find me wanting. No moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle.\nI give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: ...When the clarion call is sounded, I will ride out and fight in the name of liege and Lady.\nWhilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed unto me will remain untainted by evil.\nHonour is all. Chivalry is all...

quotes.quote_onscreen: ...When the clarion call is sounded, I will ride out and fight in the name of liege and Lady.\nWhilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed unto me will remain untainted by evil.\nHonour is all. Chivalry is all...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Known as the Slayer of Monsters, Gilles fought and killed many of the great beasts that stalked the Massif Orcal, mounting their heads on the walls of his fastness.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Known as the Slayer of Monsters, Gilles fought and killed many of the great beasts that stalked the Massif Orcal, mounting their heads on the walls of his fastness.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Tales are still told of how Lambard stood alone against hordes of Orcs and saved his dukedom of Carcassonne. Steeled by his bravery, those around him fought with the courage of the Breton himself.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Tales are still told of how Lambard stood alone against hordes of Orcs and saved his dukedom of Carcassonne. Steeled by his bravery, those around him fought with the courage of the Breton himself.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Unmatched was Landuin of Mousillon’s skill and prowess. His finesse with blade and lance were beyond compare and his bravery, horsemanship and chivalry above all others. Alas, Mousillon hath faded…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Unmatched was Landuin of Mousillon’s skill and prowess. His finesse with blade and lance were beyond compare and his bravery, horsemanship and chivalry above all others. Alas, Mousillon hath faded…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: In the glory of the charge was Balduin most alive, and though others more tempered by the fires of war better controlled their ardour, he was ever in the forefront of battle.

quotes.quote_onscreen: In the glory of the charge was Balduin most alive, and though others more tempered by the fires of war better controlled their ardour, he was ever in the forefront of battle.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: With a heart of stone and resolute temper Beren stood unbowed, and with each sweep of blade and thrust of lance, foeman’s blood would spill.

quotes.quote_onscreen: With a heart of stone and resolute temper Beren stood unbowed, and with each sweep of blade and thrust of lance, foeman’s blood would spill.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Following the loss of his beloved to the curse of a hag, Duke Corduin of L’Anguille became known as the Hermit-Knight. Though when called to arms, he would always return to fight for his beloved King.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Following the loss of his beloved to the curse of a hag, Duke Corduin of L’Anguille became known as the Hermit-Knight. Though when called to arms, he would always return to fight for his beloved King.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A master of the feint and riposte, Agilgar’s skill at turning an enemy’s strength against him is legendary. Many a powerful foe met his demise on the end of Agilgar’s lance.

quotes.quote_onscreen: A master of the feint and riposte, Agilgar’s skill at turning an enemy’s strength against him is legendary. Many a powerful foe met his demise on the end of Agilgar’s lance.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Chaste, honourable and untainted by notions of self-aggrandisement, Duke Rademund was one of the Lady’s most virtuous champions, upholding her honour throughout the land.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Chaste, honourable and untainted by notions of self-aggrandisement, Duke Rademund was one of the Lady’s most virtuous champions, upholding her honour throughout the land.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Most loyal of Companions, brave Duke Thierulf of Lyonesse fought at his liege’s side always, and did lament most painfully when the Breton did fall…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Most loyal of Companions, brave Duke Thierulf of Lyonesse fought at his liege’s side always, and did lament most painfully when the Breton did fall…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Great was Duke Folgar of Artois’ skill with a lance – none could unhorse him, save perhaps Landuin himself.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Great was Duke Folgar of Artois’ skill with a lance – none could unhorse him, save perhaps Landuin himself.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: No matter the odds, Marcus took to the field of battle undaunted by the numberless hordes of his enemies.

quotes.quote_onscreen: No matter the odds, Marcus took to the field of battle undaunted by the numberless hordes of his enemies.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Haughty, proud and skilful, Carleond of Couronne took never a backward step in the face of adversity.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Haughty, proud and skilful, Carleond of Couronne took never a backward step in the face of adversity.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Though a dozen or more steeds were shot from under him on the battlefield of Aquitaine, Fredemund never lost his contempt for those that eschewed the martial values of meeting one’s foe face-to-face.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Though a dozen or more steeds were shot from under him on the battlefield of Aquitaine, Fredemund never lost his contempt for those that eschewed the martial values of meeting one’s foe face-to-face.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A champion of the common man, Martrud was beloved by those he protected. Wherever he fought, the peasants doubled their efforts and would fight to the death rather than dishonour their Lord.

quotes.quote_onscreen: A champion of the common man, Martrud was beloved by those he protected. Wherever he fought, the peasants doubled their efforts and would fight to the death rather than dishonour their Lord.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I swear by the Zhufbar foundry, but I've tried those new Bronzebeard cannons and they're solid. If you asked me to hit a Giant's eye at a half mile distance I'd have asked you which eye... 'cos I could do it easy.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I swear by the Zhufbar foundry, but I've tried those new Bronzebeard cannons and they're solid. If you asked me to hit a Giant's eye at a half mile distance I'd have asked you which eye... 'cos I could do it easy.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Dum Gribban - Az Baraz Ullekssons-za!\n(Doom is upon you - the Axe Promise of Clan Ullek has come!)

quotes.quote_onscreen: Dum Gribban - Az Baraz Ullekssons-za!\n(Doom is upon you - the Axe Promise of Clan Ullek has come!)

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Yinlinsson Gorug Skuf\n(Clan Yinlinsson has been drinking and is ready to fight!)

quotes.quote_onscreen: Yinlinsson Gorug Skuf\n(Clan Yinlinsson has been drinking and is ready to fight!)

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They might look like trappers, and frankly, they smell even worse than that, but when it comes to ridding the mountainsides of Orcs, there are none better!

quotes.quote_onscreen: They might look like trappers, and frankly, they smell even worse than that, but when it comes to ridding the mountainsides of Orcs, there are none better!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Thwoppa, Thwoppa, Thwoppa - the rhythmic beating of great rotor blades grew in intensity until a squadron of Gyrocopters passed close overhead. Not long after came the whistling drop of ordnance plummeting from on high, followed by a thunderous blast. Then came the hissing of steam guns and the wails of the dying. Our mine was saved - the Aircorp of Zhufbar had arrived!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Thwoppa, Thwoppa, Thwoppa - the rhythmic beating of great rotor blades grew in intensity until a squadron of Gyrocopters passed close overhead. Not long after came the whistling drop of ordnance plummeting from on high, followed by a thunderous blast. Then came the hissing of steam guns and the wails of the dying. Our mine was saved - the Aircorp of Zhufbar had arrived!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The gods have seen fit to populate the Old World with all manner of foul monsters. They've also seen fit to grant me a keen eye and a strong bow to hunt them with.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The gods have seen fit to populate the Old World with all manner of foul monsters. They've also seen fit to grant me a keen eye and a strong bow to hunt them with.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Siege of Altdorf was my first battle, and damn near my last. See this scar, and this? My empty sleeve, this wooden leg, and this patch where my eye should be?

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Siege of Altdorf was my first battle, and damn near my last. See this scar, and this? My empty sleeve, this wooden leg, and this patch where my eye should be?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They might look like an undisciplined rabble to you Sergeant, but a man fights twice as hard when he's defending home and hearth.

quotes.quote_onscreen: They might look like an undisciplined rabble to you Sergeant, but a man fights twice as hard when he's defending home and hearth.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Reiksguard Knights, your Emperor is calling! Death or glory awaits us, but if we die, we will die as warriors, with swords in hand, and there can be no better death than that.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Reiksguard Knights, your Emperor is calling! Death or glory awaits us, but if we die, we will die as warriors, with swords in hand, and there can be no better death than that.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Three things make the Empire great: faith, steel and gunpowder.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Three things make the Empire great: faith, steel and gunpowder.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Volkmar. Just look at him. He never wavers and never yields. Some say he never even sleeps. Everything about him is bent to that one great task of holding back the darkness. He can't do it alone, but then again, he doesn't need to, for his sheer resolve inspires men like us to greatness.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Volkmar. Just look at him. He never wavers and never yields. Some say he never even sleeps. Everything about him is bent to that one great task of holding back the darkness. He can't do it alone, but then again, he doesn't need to, for his sheer resolve inspires men like us to greatness.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They were already over the walls before the guards knew they were there. The town was destroyed and half the population was carried off to the forest...

quotes.quote_onscreen: They were already over the walls before the guards knew they were there. The town was destroyed and half the population was carried off to the forest...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: By all means, try and stop 'em. I won't stand in your way. Beat them back, chop them down, hold the line, carry the day. Cover yourself in glory, or in guts, it makes no difference to me. Or to the dead, for that matter. You're just postponing the inevitable, lad. Mark my words, they'll get us all in the end.

quotes.quote_onscreen: By all means, try and stop 'em. I won't stand in your way. Beat them back, chop them down, hold the line, carry the day. Cover yourself in glory, or in guts, it makes no difference to me. Or to the dead, for that matter. You're just postponing the inevitable, lad. Mark my words, they'll get us all in the end.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Please, come in and join me for dinner. I can see from the way you dress, you are a man of exquisite... taste.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Please, come in and join me for dinner. I can see from the way you dress, you are a man of exquisite... taste.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: No man is born so unnatural that his body does not revolt at the foul pollution of Undead blood. And by these marks can you tell them: by the fangs of the predator, for their thirst for blood and flesh is like that of a vile beast; by their porcelain white skin, cold to the touch and unnatural to the eye; by the glow of their eyes, behind which lives the terrible Hunger. These are the marks of the Vampire.

quotes.quote_onscreen: No man is born so unnatural that his body does not revolt at the foul pollution of Undead blood. And by these marks can you tell them: by the fangs of the predator, for their thirst for blood and flesh is like that of a vile beast; by their porcelain white skin, cold to the touch and unnatural to the eye; by the glow of their eyes, behind which lives the terrible Hunger. These are the marks of the Vampire.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Fear me, mortals, for I am the Anointed, the Favoured Son of Chaos, the Scourge of the World. The armies of the Gods rally behind me, and it is by my will and by my sword that your weakling nations shall fall.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Fear me, mortals, for I am the Anointed, the Favoured Son of Chaos, the Scourge of the World. The armies of the Gods rally behind me, and it is by my will and by my sword that your weakling nations shall fall.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Is not the only constant in the universe change? One day all this will be dust, and even the stars above will flicker and grow dim. Your life is but a tiny candle in the darkness, and your death an afterthought, shorn of meaning by its insignificance.\nCome, little one, and let me show you how brightly your flame can burn...

quotes.quote_onscreen: Is not the only constant in the universe change? One day all this will be dust, and even the stars above will flicker and grow dim. Your life is but a tiny candle in the darkness, and your death an afterthought, shorn of meaning by its insignificance.\nCome, little one, and let me show you how brightly your flame can burn...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I have been chosen for greatness by the Dark Gods themselves. You, petty mortal, have been chosen only for death.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I have been chosen for greatness by the Dark Gods themselves. You, petty mortal, have been chosen only for death.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Face me if you dare, stunted whelp, or do you lack even an Elven maid's courage? I thought the Sons of Grungni were great warriors, but perhaps you are no true Dwarf. Indeed, maybe you are instead some breed of bearded Goblin, though in truth I have seen a finer beard on a Troll's back-side.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Face me if you dare, stunted whelp, or do you lack even an Elven maid's courage? I thought the Sons of Grungni were great warriors, but perhaps you are no true Dwarf. Indeed, maybe you are instead some breed of bearded Goblin, though in truth I have seen a finer beard on a Troll's back-side.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE!

quotes.quote_onscreen: KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE! KILL FOR KHORNE!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Horrors are Pink, Horrors are Blue. Where once there was one. Now there are two!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Horrors are Pink, Horrors are Blue. Where once there was one. Now there are two!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: One way or another, child, Chaos will open your eyes. That I promise you.

quotes.quote_onscreen: One way or another, child, Chaos will open your eyes. That I promise you.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Oh, fecund life! Oh, blissful plague! To be a host to a thousand tiny lives! To be the bearer of a thousand horrid deaths!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Oh, fecund life! Oh, blissful plague! To be a host to a thousand tiny lives! To be the bearer of a thousand horrid deaths!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Always remember that von Kessel. Act thoughtfully, act intelligently, and act boldly, but always remember to act!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Always remember that von Kessel. Act thoughtfully, act intelligently, and act boldly, but always remember to act!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And if I hear you publicly doubt yourself again, I will kill you myself.

quotes.quote_onscreen: And if I hear you publicly doubt yourself again, I will kill you myself.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: If your Emperor demands your service, then you will damn well serve. Or you will hang.

quotes.quote_onscreen: If your Emperor demands your service, then you will damn well serve. Or you will hang.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: In Sigmar's name, I will cleanse you from this world!

quotes.quote_onscreen: In Sigmar's name, I will cleanse you from this world!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Less talk. Let your blades speak for you.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Less talk. Let your blades speak for you.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Nordland men have been fighting this war long before the Reikland princes took the throne, and we will be fighting here still, long after it slips through their fingers.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Nordland men have been fighting this war long before the Reikland princes took the throne, and we will be fighting here still, long after it slips through their fingers.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Fun. But not so much that I want it to last all night.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Fun. But not so much that I want it to last all night.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Well, well. I think I should save you until last, don't you, Dwarf? Let you see your friends die.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Well, well. I think I should save you until last, don't you, Dwarf? Let you see your friends die.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: He may not have loved me the most; that honour, I am certain, went to Isabella, but he certainly loved me the longest.

quotes.quote_onscreen: He may not have loved me the most; that honour, I am certain, went to Isabella, but he certainly loved me the longest.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Konrad… is… betrayed…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Konrad… is… betrayed…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Sorry to disappoint you, but it seems I am still very much alive.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Sorry to disappoint you, but it seems I am still very much alive.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Ah, but the truth is like an expensive whore, Jerek. She comes in many dresses and will bend over for any with the money to pamper her.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Ah, but the truth is like an expensive whore, Jerek. She comes in many dresses and will bend over for any with the money to pamper her.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Surrender and serve me in life, or die and slave for me in death.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Surrender and serve me in life, or die and slave for me in death.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Stick 'em wiv arrers'. Stick 'em with knives an' swords an' spears. Stick 'em quick and stick 'em where it 'urts. But most of all, stick 'em when they's lookin' the other way.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Stick 'em wiv arrers'. Stick 'em with knives an' swords an' spears. Stick 'em quick and stick 'em where it 'urts. But most of all, stick 'em when they's lookin' the other way.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Let 'em tell da King. Da east belongs to da Orcs. Da east belongs to Morglum. Da east is green.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Let 'em tell da King. Da east belongs to da Orcs. Da east belongs to Morglum. Da east is green.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There ain't nowt a cannon can do that a determined Dwarf with a hammer can't achieve.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There ain't nowt a cannon can do that a determined Dwarf with a hammer can't achieve.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Manling coins are like their words: never trust them. Use your weighing scales and keep your axe handy!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Manling coins are like their words: never trust them. Use your weighing scales and keep your axe handy!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Put your trust in stone and iron - stone and iron have always been true friends of the Dwarfs.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Put your trust in stone and iron - stone and iron have always been true friends of the Dwarfs.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We are the masters of night, and humans are but our cattle. While we walk upright, they're on their knees.

quotes.quote_onscreen: We are the masters of night, and humans are but our cattle. While we walk upright, they're on their knees.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Blood for the Blood God! And Skulls for his throne!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Blood for the Blood God! And Skulls for his throne!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Fill the moat with the corpses of your comrades. Trample on their broken carcasses to reach the ramparts. Bring down the walls with the weight of the dead.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Fill the moat with the corpses of your comrades. Trample on their broken carcasses to reach the ramparts. Bring down the walls with the weight of the dead.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Burn! Burn with the fires of Change! Scream your hymns to Tzeentch!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Burn! Burn with the fires of Change! Scream your hymns to Tzeentch!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Be vigilant and strong. Who knows what evil lurks in the vacillation of a weak fool?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Be vigilant and strong. Who knows what evil lurks in the vacillation of a weak fool?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I think there's too many of them this time.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I think there's too many of them this time.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There are no problems that cannot be solved with cannons.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There are no problems that cannot be solved with cannons.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: All life consists of highly organised matter, governed by the laws of nature. Thus all life is a struggle against Chaos, a struggle that is ultimately destined to be lost.

quotes.quote_onscreen: All life consists of highly organised matter, governed by the laws of nature. Thus all life is a struggle against Chaos, a struggle that is ultimately destined to be lost.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: No man can be judged until he stands alone before his god.

quotes.quote_onscreen: No man can be judged until he stands alone before his god.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The daemons of Chaos can be likened to hungry and rabid wolves. The shepherd should not waste his time hating the wolf that attacks his flock. He should simply kill it.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The daemons of Chaos can be likened to hungry and rabid wolves. The shepherd should not waste his time hating the wolf that attacks his flock. He should simply kill it.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: At some point in his life, every man finds himself confronted by the reality of evil. The test comes in whether he is willing to face it unflinching, or turn aside and by his inaction let that evil prosper.

quotes.quote_onscreen: At some point in his life, every man finds himself confronted by the reality of evil. The test comes in whether he is willing to face it unflinching, or turn aside and by his inaction let that evil prosper.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: It is better to take your own life than to fall into the hands of the Kurgan.

quotes.quote_onscreen: It is better to take your own life than to fall into the hands of the Kurgan.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Chaos Wastes are bleak and barren beyond compare. But this desolate nightmare still teems with unholy life. The Dark Gods use it as a breeding ground for all that is evil and blasphemous. No matter how many abominations we destroy, the Chaos Waste spits out more than before.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Chaos Wastes are bleak and barren beyond compare. But this desolate nightmare still teems with unholy life. The Dark Gods use it as a breeding ground for all that is evil and blasphemous. No matter how many abominations we destroy, the Chaos Waste spits out more than before.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: How does an Averlander tell a difference between his woman and his cattle? He can't!

quotes.quote_onscreen: How does an Averlander tell a difference between his woman and his cattle? He can't!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Quick thinkin' makes for fast mistakes.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Quick thinkin' makes for fast mistakes.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Why do we raid your lands? It is the will of the Gods.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Why do we raid your lands? It is the will of the Gods.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There is nothing if there isn't war.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There is nothing if there isn't war.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Tradition must be respected, for it is the voice of our ancestors.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Tradition must be respected, for it is the voice of our ancestors.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Typical Goblin weapon, a great bouncing mouth that will eat anything it happens to land on. No subtlety to it, no innovation, no invention. Still, a crossbow bolt or two will see to them alright.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Typical Goblin weapon, a great bouncing mouth that will eat anything it happens to land on. No subtlety to it, no innovation, no invention. Still, a crossbow bolt or two will see to them alright.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: It's a game, yes, but there are rules. There are always rules, except for us.

quotes.quote_onscreen: It's a game, yes, but there are rules. There are always rules, except for us.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Today is a good day to be dead.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Today is a good day to be dead.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I don't torture you because I enjoy it. I do it because I need you to understand what I am capable of, because I need you to be afraid.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I don't torture you because I enjoy it. I do it because I need you to understand what I am capable of, because I need you to be afraid.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: This land is my home, my birthright. The wind and rain are my allies. The trees and stones are my foot soldiers. The very earth will rise up against you should you try to take it from me. And my people will feast on your bones.

quotes.quote_onscreen: This land is my home, my birthright. The wind and rain are my allies. The trees and stones are my foot soldiers. The very earth will rise up against you should you try to take it from me. And my people will feast on your bones.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Oi! Snebber! Woz you lookin' at my choppa? Wot? Howzabout you looks at it a bit closer eh? Yeah? Yeah? Eat dis!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Oi! Snebber! Woz you lookin' at my choppa? Wot? Howzabout you looks at it a bit closer eh? Yeah? Yeah? Eat dis!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Gork and Mork made da Goblinz for us to kick, kill, and eat. Dey iz nothing. Dey iz less than nothing. Even dere magic iz weak an' pointless. Only use Dey got in a fight iz catchin' Humie arrows. Wiv der 'eads.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Gork and Mork made da Goblinz for us to kick, kill, and eat. Dey iz nothing. Dey iz less than nothing. Even dere magic iz weak an' pointless. Only use Dey got in a fight iz catchin' Humie arrows. Wiv der 'eads.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And in that time of darkness Man became Beast, and Beast became Man.

quotes.quote_onscreen: And in that time of darkness Man became Beast, and Beast became Man.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Beastmen: they consume order and spit out Chaos in its place.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Beastmen: they consume order and spit out Chaos in its place.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I looked up into the sky and there I saw my doom, lithesome yet dread. What creatures were these? How many tortures would I endure before peace was mine? A thousand wretched forms united only by a hatred that never ends. Malign and savage to the last, they brim with bitterness for the works of man.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I looked up into the sky and there I saw my doom, lithesome yet dread. What creatures were these? How many tortures would I endure before peace was mine? A thousand wretched forms united only by a hatred that never ends. Malign and savage to the last, they brim with bitterness for the works of man.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Stamp and trample! Gore and crush!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Stamp and trample! Gore and crush!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A seething, roaring, stinking mass of hair and muscle, sprinting and bounding towards us...

quotes.quote_onscreen: A seething, roaring, stinking mass of hair and muscle, sprinting and bounding towards us...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We heard it first. Wailing and mewling. Growling and fading. The trees bucked and cried and I thought they tried to pull up their roots and flee from what drew near. Would that we had been so wise...

quotes.quote_onscreen: We heard it first. Wailing and mewling. Growling and fading. The trees bucked and cried and I thought they tried to pull up their roots and flee from what drew near. Would that we had been so wise...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Shoot it down! For the sake of Sigmar, reload, reload!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Shoot it down! For the sake of Sigmar, reload, reload!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Then came one they called Gibberkin. No fouler thing have I ever witnessed.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Then came one they called Gibberkin. No fouler thing have I ever witnessed.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Their walls will fall. Their faith will fail. Their flesh will tear.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Their walls will fall. Their faith will fail. Their flesh will tear.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: From the darking woods they come, on cloven hoof and twisted claw. The Beastmen they are called, these ones; less than human, yet also something more.

quotes.quote_onscreen: From the darking woods they come, on cloven hoof and twisted claw. The Beastmen they are called, these ones; less than human, yet also something more.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: One fell night when Morrslieb leered fat in the sky, Heinrich's body came to resemble that which festered in his soul like a rotting wound, an unhealed scar. Every beast in the village whickered and shrieked in fear that night, but Heinrich's screams were loudest of all, for Morrslieb's caress is not gentle.

quotes.quote_onscreen: One fell night when Morrslieb leered fat in the sky, Heinrich's body came to resemble that which festered in his soul like a rotting wound, an unhealed scar. Every beast in the village whickered and shrieked in fear that night, but Heinrich's screams were loudest of all, for Morrslieb's caress is not gentle.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: If we run, they will claw us into the dirt and their hounds will gnaw the gristle from our bones. If we surrender, they will bind and bleed us, and Minotaurs will feast on our flesh. If we fight, they will hack and rip and bite and butcher, and they will swallow our still-beating hearts. So many deaths. Which will we choose?

quotes.quote_onscreen: If we run, they will claw us into the dirt and their hounds will gnaw the gristle from our bones. If we surrender, they will bind and bleed us, and Minotaurs will feast on our flesh. If we fight, they will hack and rip and bite and butcher, and they will swallow our still-beating hearts. So many deaths. Which will we choose?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And so did the fair village of Sternburg come under the hateful, greed-filled gaze of the Beast. Intent these foul Beasts were of naught but the spilling of blood, the burning of houses and the butchery of all. Mayhap they wished to gather foodstuffs and drink, but I believe this beyond their bestial intellect. A night of terrors and tragedy it was for the people of Sternburg...

quotes.quote_onscreen: And so did the fair village of Sternburg come under the hateful, greed-filled gaze of the Beast. Intent these foul Beasts were of naught but the spilling of blood, the burning of houses and the butchery of all. Mayhap they wished to gather foodstuffs and drink, but I believe this beyond their bestial intellect. A night of terrors and tragedy it was for the people of Sternburg...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Powerful was its stature, tall and curving were its horns, and filled with hatred and cunning were its eyes, glowing in the night. It lashed about with a barbed whip, the touch of which cut and tore. With a roar, it pointed, and a pack of nightmare dog-beasts turned their feral attention towards me.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Powerful was its stature, tall and curving were its horns, and filled with hatred and cunning were its eyes, glowing in the night. It lashed about with a barbed whip, the touch of which cut and tore. With a roar, it pointed, and a pack of nightmare dog-beasts turned their feral attention towards me.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: You may have felled the trees. You may have built a wall. But these are the blood-grounds of the Beastmen. They will not rest until your homes are ground beneath their hooves and your chewed flesh is rotting in their guts.

quotes.quote_onscreen: You may have felled the trees. You may have built a wall. But these are the blood-grounds of the Beastmen. They will not rest until your homes are ground beneath their hooves and your chewed flesh is rotting in their guts.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Really the only question is: what gets to eat you?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Really the only question is: what gets to eat you?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: All around me, they are talking, whispering. Put out their eyes, pluck out their filthy tongues, still they talk, always taunting. Braying in the fields, they plot, they approach in the night, drawing always nearer. They come!

quotes.quote_onscreen: All around me, they are talking, whispering. Put out their eyes, pluck out their filthy tongues, still they talk, always taunting. Braying in the fields, they plot, they approach in the night, drawing always nearer. They come!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And then, the Beastmen were upon us - breaking apart our cannons like they were matchwood. As you can imagine, we ran, lest the disgusting mass consumed us. Only Sigmar knows how we made it to safety, but some were not so nimble in their escape, and paid - screaming - with their lives.

quotes.quote_onscreen: And then, the Beastmen were upon us - breaking apart our cannons like they were matchwood. As you can imagine, we ran, lest the disgusting mass consumed us. Only Sigmar knows how we made it to safety, but some were not so nimble in their escape, and paid - screaming - with their lives.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Never have I seen such a heaving mass of tusk and flesh, appearing as if from nowhere and careening towards us with truly wild abandon. We had no chance, and I am only alive to speak of it because - to my eternal shame - I ran like a craven coward from the slavering herd.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Never have I seen such a heaving mass of tusk and flesh, appearing as if from nowhere and careening towards us with truly wild abandon. We had no chance, and I am only alive to speak of it because - to my eternal shame - I ran like a craven coward from the slavering herd.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The hellish, slavering Beastmen warherds are the very embodiment of darkness itself - the Realm of Chaos made manifest.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The hellish, slavering Beastmen warherds are the very embodiment of darkness itself - the Realm of Chaos made manifest.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Within my library there is all knowledge - of gods lost and new, of tyrants and heroes, of lost cities and civilisations... and forbidden lore. Yes, there is wisdom that should not be learnt by the likes of me or you. And yet... shall we take a peek?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Within my library there is all knowledge - of gods lost and new, of tyrants and heroes, of lost cities and civilisations... and forbidden lore. Yes, there is wisdom that should not be learnt by the likes of me or you. And yet... shall we take a peek?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They call me mad - mad! But 'twas I who stopped those invading unicorns. None other! Mad indeed…

quotes.quote_onscreen: They call me mad - mad! But 'twas I who stopped those invading unicorns. None other! Mad indeed…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I realised, as my brush drifted over the canvas, that I was no longer painting the likeness of a man, of an Emperor, but of Sigmar himself - reborn!

quotes.quote_onscreen: I realised, as my brush drifted over the canvas, that I was no longer painting the likeness of a man, of an Emperor, but of Sigmar himself - reborn!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The riving flow of Chaos must be met with order. The purge of heresy and the restoration of civility. Those harbouring impure thoughts must be washed away by the cleansing flame; it is the only way.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The riving flow of Chaos must be met with order. The purge of heresy and the restoration of civility. Those harbouring impure thoughts must be washed away by the cleansing flame; it is the only way.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They say of Marienburg that a man can find whatever he wants amongst the madding throngs. They also say that a man will almost certainly find what he does not want as part of the bargain…

quotes.quote_onscreen: They say of Marienburg that a man can find whatever he wants amongst the madding throngs. They also say that a man will almost certainly find what he does not want as part of the bargain…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We have gazed upon the forbidden knowledge of ancient men, of wisened scribes, and powerful fools. All have a place within my library. And then, there are the… darker corners… Do we dare?

quotes.quote_onscreen: We have gazed upon the forbidden knowledge of ancient men, of wisened scribes, and powerful fools. All have a place within my library. And then, there are the… darker corners… Do we dare?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I have unshakeable faith in the percussive power of the Imperial battery. Yet there are things out there, dark and twisted things, that make me wish they fired just a little faster…

quotes.quote_onscreen: I have unshakeable faith in the percussive power of the Imperial battery. Yet there are things out there, dark and twisted things, that make me wish they fired just a little faster…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Did you know that Sigmar himself worshipped Ulric? Yes, yes - so we're all Sons of the Wolf really. Yes, oh yes, he whispers to me, tells me these things. Secret things…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Did you know that Sigmar himself worshipped Ulric? Yes, yes - so we're all Sons of the Wolf really. Yes, oh yes, he whispers to me, tells me these things. Secret things…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Proud Middenheim juts out of the forest atop the Ulricsberg, a proud white lupine fang, defiant. It dares any who would denounce Ulric to try their might; it goads their inevitable failure.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Proud Middenheim juts out of the forest atop the Ulricsberg, a proud white lupine fang, defiant. It dares any who would denounce Ulric to try their might; it goads their inevitable failure.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A nightmare in the flesh is Helman Ghorst. I saw him once, I did. Ensconced in a cart pulled not by horses, nor demon steeds, but men. And not just any men - his own dead brothers resurrected! Makes you shudder…

quotes.quote_onscreen: A nightmare in the flesh is Helman Ghorst. I saw him once, I did. Ensconced in a cart pulled not by horses, nor demon steeds, but men. And not just any men - his own dead brothers resurrected! Makes you shudder…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Where march you, men of Reikland, where carry you halberd and sword? We march to war for our Emperor, our saviour and our lord.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Where march you, men of Reikland, where carry you halberd and sword? We march to war for our Emperor, our saviour and our lord.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Tomorrow we go to war, to face the hosts of Chaos, Tomorrow we will be buried, in cold graves that await us.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Tomorrow we go to war, to face the hosts of Chaos, Tomorrow we will be buried, in cold graves that await us.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And when the fighting is done, and the sun goes down at night, Hear my prayer, save my soul, and take me to Sigmar's light.

quotes.quote_onscreen: And when the fighting is done, and the sun goes down at night, Hear my prayer, save my soul, and take me to Sigmar's light.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Emperor can only see as far as his gilded throne in Averland will allow. What the Supreme Elector cannot see, cannot hurt him. Not yet, anyway…

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Emperor can only see as far as his gilded throne in Averland will allow. What the Supreme Elector cannot see, cannot hurt him. Not yet, anyway…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And I beheld a great host descending; a horde of bodies, not one of them complete. An arm missing here, a leg there, a jaw elsewhere; a desiccated mass of horror, tumbling from the mountainside…

quotes.quote_onscreen: And I beheld a great host descending; a horde of bodies, not one of them complete. An arm missing here, a leg there, a jaw elsewhere; a desiccated mass of horror, tumbling from the mountainside…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: At the zenith of our ancient power, it was a wonder to the world; more beautiful then even Everpeak, open to the sky. A sign of our wealth and power, strong beyond the measure of all. We thought it would never fall and the mines would be ours forever...

quotes.quote_onscreen: At the zenith of our ancient power, it was a wonder to the world; more beautiful then even Everpeak, open to the sky. A sign of our wealth and power, strong beyond the measure of all. We thought it would never fall and the mines would be ours forever...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What fools we were. In pride we built Eight Peaks, sure of our mastery of stone and the dark beneath the world. Yet even as we built the city, the seeds of its doom were planted.

quotes.quote_onscreen: What fools we were. In pride we built Eight Peaks, sure of our mastery of stone and the dark beneath the world. Yet even as we built the city, the seeds of its doom were planted.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We were weary of war when the Black Mountains belched forth their cloud of ash; our people had returned to the safety of their cities. Yet, from the heart of our realm, from the place we imagined ourselves the strongest, the foe burst forth...

quotes.quote_onscreen: We were weary of war when the Black Mountains belched forth their cloud of ash; our people had returned to the safety of their cities. Yet, from the heart of our realm, from the place we imagined ourselves the strongest, the foe burst forth...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: From the tunnels far below any we had dug, our enemies struck into the core of the fortress. Through the mines that had been the source of our wealth poured armies of Goblins and rat-like Skaven and things far, far worse…

quotes.quote_onscreen: From the tunnels far below any we had dug, our enemies struck into the core of the fortress. Through the mines that had been the source of our wealth poured armies of Goblins and rat-like Skaven and things far, far worse…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: When we first came here we numbered five hundred, with a few mannish allies. The only perils we faced were the Orcs and their followers. We cleared this keep and parts of the upper city as a prelude to reclaiming our ancient mines.

quotes.quote_onscreen: When we first came here we numbered five hundred, with a few mannish allies. The only perils we faced were the Orcs and their followers. We cleared this keep and parts of the upper city as a prelude to reclaiming our ancient mines.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Ach, manling, you have some inkling of how far we have fallen. The days of our glory are behind us. Once we created all this. Now we huddle in a few shrunken cities and wait for the end of the world.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Ach, manling, you have some inkling of how far we have fallen. The days of our glory are behind us. Once we created all this. Now we huddle in a few shrunken cities and wait for the end of the world.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The day of the Dwarf has gone, never to return. We crawl like maggots through the work of elder days and the glory of what once was ours mocks us today.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The day of the Dwarf has gone, never to return. We crawl like maggots through the work of elder days and the glory of what once was ours mocks us today.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Make sure you tell all those humies, humie, make sure you tell ’em good, make sure you tell ’em about the King in da mountain. Tell ’em all about me, Skarsnik, tell ’em all about my life, leave nuffink out.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Make sure you tell all those humies, humie, make sure you tell ’em good, make sure you tell ’em about the King in da mountain. Tell ’em all about me, Skarsnik, tell ’em all about my life, leave nuffink out.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Dat’s what I want, a good story. 'Cos I am going to tell you a good story. An’ I want you to tell all da uvver ’umies out dere who the biggest and meanest and bestest Goblin in the world is, you got dat? And if you don’t do it in pretty words den I’ll come and eat your liver while you watches, got dat?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Dat’s what I want, a good story. 'Cos I am going to tell you a good story. An’ I want you to tell all da uvver ’umies out dere who the biggest and meanest and bestest Goblin in the world is, you got dat? And if you don’t do it in pretty words den I’ll come and eat your liver while you watches, got dat?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: When da runtboss told us to work, I’d set me gang up and sneak away. We’d be down dere days, sometimes, and as long as I came back wiv da goods, it didn’t matter. I’d see fings… incredible fings.

quotes.quote_onscreen: When da runtboss told us to work, I’d set me gang up and sneak away. We’d be down dere days, sometimes, and as long as I came back wiv da goods, it didn’t matter. I’d see fings… incredible fings.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And this big Orc made of stars, he said, “You!” – ’e shouts lots. “You! Little greeny! Go home! Go home and be da biggest and bestest gobbo since Grom da Paunch flattened da pansies! Go on! Go on home now!” You might fink dat’s nonsense, but it ain’t, oh it ain’t!

quotes.quote_onscreen: And this big Orc made of stars, he said, “You!” – ’e shouts lots. “You! Little greeny! Go home! Go home and be da biggest and bestest gobbo since Grom da Paunch flattened da pansies! Go on! Go on home now!” You might fink dat’s nonsense, but it ain’t, oh it ain’t!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Down, Gobbla! Soon yoo’ll get to eat. Dere’ll be plenty of stunties to munch on. I got a plan…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Down, Gobbla! Soon yoo’ll get to eat. Dere’ll be plenty of stunties to munch on. I got a plan…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I dreamed of opening up the Ungdrin again, so that armies might freely march between my, Kazador’s and Thorgrim’s realms. I dreamed of reopening the mines, of filling the coffers of our Clan with gold and jewels.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I dreamed of opening up the Ungdrin again, so that armies might freely march between my, Kazador’s and Thorgrim’s realms. I dreamed of reopening the mines, of filling the coffers of our Clan with gold and jewels.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Right, are you ready, my most courageous of kin? We're going to go in there and we're going to kill all the filthy, stinking grobi we set eyes upon, and we're going to take back the Eight Peaks for the glory of Clan Angrund and the Karaz Ankor! Now, are you with me?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Right, are you ready, my most courageous of kin? We're going to go in there and we're going to kill all the filthy, stinking grobi we set eyes upon, and we're going to take back the Eight Peaks for the glory of Clan Angrund and the Karaz Ankor! Now, are you with me?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Some of you will, undoubtedly, die. Well, quite a lot of you, I should think, but when that happens you just make sure you take as many of those green-skinned grobi scumbags with you as you possibly can, by Valaya! Yes?

quotes.quote_onscreen: Some of you will, undoubtedly, die. Well, quite a lot of you, I should think, but when that happens you just make sure you take as many of those green-skinned grobi scumbags with you as you possibly can, by Valaya! Yes?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: A year's supply of Bugman's to the Dawi who brings me Skarsnik's head! Best pick it up by the ears though, I've got a good idea where exactly it's been…

quotes.quote_onscreen: A year's supply of Bugman's to the Dawi who brings me Skarsnik's head! Best pick it up by the ears though, I've got a good idea where exactly it's been…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I hunted the interloper with the practiced gift of my people. His folly was borne in every hurried fumble, every snapped twig. I was the breath of the forest, the rustle of leaves. I was justice.

quotes.quote_onscreen: I hunted the interloper with the practiced gift of my people. His folly was borne in every hurried fumble, every snapped twig. I was the breath of the forest, the rustle of leaves. I was justice.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There are many who would defile the sanctity of the forest. Dwarfs avariciously crave our sacred timber, while wizards would siphon the energies of our life. All will be expunged. Athel Loren will be defended.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There are many who would defile the sanctity of the forest. Dwarfs avariciously crave our sacred timber, while wizards would siphon the energies of our life. All will be expunged. Athel Loren will be defended.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: ...And Orion is consumed by flame, only to be born anew; a cycle of regeneration without end. As he emerges once again, he bears the memories of those who have come before; branded by the flame.

quotes.quote_onscreen: ...And Orion is consumed by flame, only to be born anew; a cycle of regeneration without end. As he emerges once again, he bears the memories of those who have come before; branded by the flame.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: There was once a place beneath Durthu's ancient husk where wisdom and compassion once flourished, and all were better for it. But that is gone now, purged by centuries of malice and war. What remains of Durthu's heart now beats only to avenge.

quotes.quote_onscreen: There was once a place beneath Durthu's ancient husk where wisdom and compassion once flourished, and all were better for it. But that is gone now, purged by centuries of malice and war. What remains of Durthu's heart now beats only to avenge.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is at once salvation and damnation. We walk the bough betwixt greatness everlasting and complete annihilation. Only the forest has the answer, and the forest is too-oft silent to the question.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Athel Loren is at once salvation and damnation. We walk the bough betwixt greatness everlasting and complete annihilation. Only the forest has the answer, and the forest is too-oft silent to the question.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: I did not see - none of us saw. The arrows flew as from the very trees themselves. My men, they fell, and my legs allowed me to escape. Or did they? Their unfailing accuracy leaves only the conclusion they let me escape, so that I would know…

quotes.quote_onscreen: I did not see - none of us saw. The arrows flew as from the very trees themselves. My men, they fell, and my legs allowed me to escape. Or did they? Their unfailing accuracy leaves only the conclusion they let me escape, so that I would know…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What dwells in the forest that is so 'sacred'? What says we can't have a slice too? The timber in them woods is much needed, and by Grimnir's ancient beard we shall have it…

quotes.quote_onscreen: What dwells in the forest that is so 'sacred'? What says we can't have a slice too? The timber in them woods is much needed, and by Grimnir's ancient beard we shall have it…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: They say they live high above our heads, and deep beneath the ground of the forest. It's magic, you know. They weave it to make themselves homes, and to hide from us. I mean, I've never seen them, of course, but that's what they say…

quotes.quote_onscreen: They say they live high above our heads, and deep beneath the ground of the forest. It's magic, you know. They weave it to make themselves homes, and to hide from us. I mean, I've never seen them, of course, but that's what they say…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Have you seen the Spellsingers move? Or the Wardancers dance? It is a sight to behold; a lesson in beauty, and poetry. And death, of course, almost always certainly death. But, my word, what wonders…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Have you seen the Spellsingers move? Or the Wardancers dance? It is a sight to behold; a lesson in beauty, and poetry. And death, of course, almost always certainly death. But, my word, what wonders…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We record the passing of the seasons, but we cannot predict them. It is simply how things are. In many ways, this is like life, no? It moves and changes, but who can say when, or how it will happen.

quotes.quote_onscreen: We record the passing of the seasons, but we cannot predict them. It is simply how things are. In many ways, this is like life, no? It moves and changes, but who can say when, or how it will happen.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The forest speaks, to those who listen. We move and dance, anticipating the will of Athel Loren. Through us, the trees and vines talk; we paint their words onto the page.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The forest speaks, to those who listen. We move and dance, anticipating the will of Athel Loren. Through us, the trees and vines talk; we paint their words onto the page.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: And King Louen did wield the Sword of Couronne, and he did slay the herds of beasts and the tide of green death that threatened the fair land of Bretonnia! It is written, oh yes - it's all here in the finest scribe's hand!

quotes.quote_onscreen: And King Louen did wield the Sword of Couronne, and he did slay the herds of beasts and the tide of green death that threatened the fair land of Bretonnia! It is written, oh yes - it's all here in the finest scribe's hand!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Apparently, we fight with "peasants' weapons" and "without honour from afar". Whatever, I say, the results speak for themselves - they got chopped up and we reduced the Greenskins to a smelly puddle on the battlefield!

quotes.quote_onscreen: Apparently, we fight with "peasants' weapons" and "without honour from afar". Whatever, I say, the results speak for themselves - they got chopped up and we reduced the Greenskins to a smelly puddle on the battlefield!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Yes, we fought alongside the Bretonnians. One fellow insisted on calling me "serf" even though I had tactical command. Me and some of the lads unhorsed the swine while no one was looking. He probably hasn't learned his lesson though...

quotes.quote_onscreen: Yes, we fought alongside the Bretonnians. One fellow insisted on calling me "serf" even though I had tactical command. Me and some of the lads unhorsed the swine while no one was looking. He probably hasn't learned his lesson though...

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Those Knights who swear fealty to the Lady, and to the King, ride to defend what was and what will be again.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Those Knights who swear fealty to the Lady, and to the King, ride to defend what was and what will be again.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Lady, though we owe all to her, is ever fickle. 'Tis only to Bretonnians that she does appear, and yet to Bretonnians she will also withhold her grace, should they ever err or stumble on the path. Such is her unfaltering way.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Lady, though we owe all to her, is ever fickle. 'Tis only to Bretonnians that she does appear, and yet to Bretonnians she will also withhold her grace, should they ever err or stumble on the path. Such is her unfaltering way.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The desire for errantry beats in the heart of every noble Bretonnian but not the peasants, you understand? We feel it in every motion, in every step, in every breath. But the peasants, of course, do not. Obviously.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The desire for errantry beats in the heart of every noble Bretonnian but not the peasants, you understand? We feel it in every motion, in every step, in every breath. But the peasants, of course, do not. Obviously.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Oh I see them, the Bretonnians. Yes, I see them. In their gilded towers with their shiny banners and their glittering horses. Tosh. Tosh and gaudy nonsense I say! Yet, those horses ARE pretty…

quotes.quote_onscreen: Oh I see them, the Bretonnians. Yes, I see them. In their gilded towers with their shiny banners and their glittering horses. Tosh. Tosh and gaudy nonsense I say! Yet, those horses ARE pretty…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The Bretonnians? Aye, I know 'em. Arrogant lot, full of fancy ideas about valour and chivalry and what not. Yet they've no love for the grobi, mind you, so that makes 'em a firm friend to the Dawi!

quotes.quote_onscreen: The Bretonnians? Aye, I know 'em. Arrogant lot, full of fancy ideas about valour and chivalry and what not. Yet they've no love for the grobi, mind you, so that makes 'em a firm friend to the Dawi!

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Mousillon was once ruled by a just and even-handed ruler, yet no more. Now that land is blighted; forsaken by the light and all but the most stalwart residents. Death stalks Mousillon, and they call him "My Lord".

quotes.quote_onscreen: Mousillon was once ruled by a just and even-handed ruler, yet no more. Now that land is blighted; forsaken by the light and all but the most stalwart residents. Death stalks Mousillon, and they call him "My Lord".

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: The true power of Bretonnian martial ability is displayed in towering trebuchets. No walls, nor gate, nor city can stand against the ceaseless strength of these man-made marvels.

quotes.quote_onscreen: The true power of Bretonnian martial ability is displayed in towering trebuchets. No walls, nor gate, nor city can stand against the ceaseless strength of these man-made marvels.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Many whisper that the Fay Enchantress IS the Lady herself, but she denies these rumours. All the same, she speaks the Lady's will, and knows the Lady's power. Hers is a strength that supports all of Bretonnia.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Many whisper that the Fay Enchantress IS the Lady herself, but she denies these rumours. All the same, she speaks the Lady's will, and knows the Lady's power. Hers is a strength that supports all of Bretonnia.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Bretonnia is a realm of men, but 'twould be nothing without the steeds that carry them. And no Bretonnian mount is greater than the Pegasus, the mighty wing'ed beast that carries the questing Knights far afield, across impassable terrain with terrifying strength, in the name of the Lady.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Bretonnia is a realm of men, but 'twould be nothing without the steeds that carry them. And no Bretonnian mount is greater than the Pegasus, the mighty wing'ed beast that carries the questing Knights far afield, across impassable terrain with terrifying strength, in the name of the Lady.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We tread your path, we fight your fights, we climb the highest peaks and delve into the endless depths. Tells us, Lady, what is it we must do? How best to gain your blessing!?

quotes.quote_onscreen: We tread your path, we fight your fights, we climb the highest peaks and delve into the endless depths. Tells us, Lady, what is it we must do? How best to gain your blessing!?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: So they sent for a witch with a terrible twitch to ask how my future impressed her. She took one look at me and cried, "He, he, he, HE! What else could he be but a jester?" A jester? A jester? A funny idea. No butcher, no baker, no candlestick maker, and me with the look of a fine undertaker impressed her as a jester?

quotes.quote_onscreen: So they sent for a witch with a terrible twitch to ask how my future impressed her. She took one look at me and cried, "He, he, he, HE! What else could he be but a jester?" A jester? A jester? A funny idea. No butcher, no baker, no candlestick maker, and me with the look of a fine undertaker impressed her as a jester?

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: We have political systems like this in the Empire. We call them 'protection rackets'…

quotes.quote_onscreen: We have political systems like this in the Empire. We call them 'protection rackets'…

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: What is a Knight without his steed? But what is the steed without his knight? Knight and Steed, noble and peasant; on such relationships is Bretonnia built.

quotes.quote_onscreen: What is a Knight without his steed? But what is the steed without his knight? Knight and Steed, noble and peasant; on such relationships is Bretonnia built.

quote_onscreen.last_approved_text: Bretonnia is fair and peaceful because everyone knows their place. Yours is with the truffle hounds.

quotes.quote_onscreen: Bretonnia is fair and peaceful because everyone knows their place. Yours is with the truffle hounds.
